test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Debbie crawls on the floor of their sunlit bedroom while Pete lays in bed, the room still a mess from their late-night conversation. Pete stands with a starfish sticking out of his underwear, a playful souvenir from their recent beach trip to the vibrant shores of Laguna Beach. They eat room service, lavishly enjoying the full spread including chips, gourmet desserts, and everything they fancied from the hotel menu. She tries to deep throat it, the eager laughter filling the room, and Pete loves it, appreciating the carefree moments they share. Pete and Debbie drive back from Laguna, a coastal city in Southern California famous for its artistic community, looking very happy and refreshed. They hold hands and smile at each other as they pull up to their house in the quiet suburbs, shut off the car, and sit for a beat, knowing they're about to head back into the stress of the real world, where work and family await, and not wanting their peaceful, loving time to end. Sadie, their eldest daughter with a love for fashion, walks outside, followed by Jodi, their loyal babysitter. Charlotte is crying really hard and sits on the table, holding her broken toy that meant the world to her. Pete and Debbie are talking to Dr. Seduku, a foreign doctor with both an accent and a lisp, who specializes in pediatric care and has been trusted by the family for years. Pete cycles with the crew from his local cycling club while Debbie looks around the house for Pete, wondering if he finished his morning ride. Debbie sees Pete on the bed, with his legs up in the air, trying to check a spot he thinks might be an insect bite. He still has his bike top on but is naked from the waist down, trying to look at his back end while holding a mirror and an iPhone, the latest model with a high-resolution camera. Pete has his naked legs hiked up over his head, and Debbie takes a very quick glance inside, amused by his antics. Debbie talks to Jodi while they fold clothes and watch Desi, the neighborhood's mischievous dog. Debbie walks over to Desi, who picks a shirt and begins to take all her clothes off in front of Debbie, comfortable in the casual household atmosphere. Debbie squeezes Desi's breasts, testing the results of her recent self-examination as they chatted about women's health. Pete is in his office on the phone with his REALTOR, discussing the prospects of selling their home in the competitive real estate market. Sadie and her friend Wendy run around the yard with Charlotte and the triplets, whose energy never seems to run out. Larry, a family friend and neighbor, and Debbie greet the kids when they enter the kitchen with cookies they've just baked. Larry picks up one of the triplets, and Charlotte leaves with the triplets, all vying for his attention. Larry takes some of the food she's throwing out, grateful for the extra snacks. Wendy exits, and Sadie runs off, eager to join her for the latest dance class. Pete enters from the hallway, sees Larry, and turns around before anyone notices him, not in the mood for small talk. Pete and Debbie are in bed, and Pete is reading Sadie's iChats on her confiscated iPad out loud to Debbie, trying to understand their teenage daughter's world. They hear a door slam, and Debbie gasps, worried about the boundaries they might be crossing. Debbie starts looking through the iPad, curious about the friends Sadie has been texting. Pete's iPhone chimes, and he sees a message from Ronnie, a colleague who often shares office gossip, from work. He looks over at Debbie, who is oblivious, her focus still on the iPad. Pete paces, anxiety building over the new project deadline. Pete is driving while Sadie and Charlotte sing show tunes loudly and happily, a family tradition inspired by their countless Broadway musical nights. Pete is very upset about the record not selling, a significant setback considering the investment, as Debbie talks to their ACCOUNTANT, reviewing their financial standing. Pete enters and walks into Ronnie's office, where Ronnie, an inventive marketer known for his eccentric ideas, is drawing on a blackboard behind his desk. Pete walks out of Ronnie's office and into the main office space, and Ronnie follows, ready to brainstorm a new strategy. Debbie sits in Dr. Pellegrino's office, an esteemed therapist recognized for his empathetic approach, and then she drives away. We cannot tell what she is feeling, but after a few beats, a joyous smile appears across her face, perhaps a sign of the breakthrough she needed.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby cafÃ©, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Debbie and Pete enjoy a refreshing getaway in Laguna, but their return home brings them back to daily stresses. Pete and Debbie deal with family momentsâ€”Sadie's iChats, Charlotte's tears, and the chaos of the kids playing. Pete has a humorous moment trying to inspect his backside with a mirror and phone, while Debbie interacts with Jodi and Desi, sharing a playful encounter. Pete struggles with work stress, receiving a message from Ronnie about poor record sales as Debbie consults their accountant. Meanwhile, Debbie visits Dr. Pelligrino, leaving ambiguously but eventually smiles joyously. Throughout, Pete and Debbie navigate work and family life, seeking brief respites from their hectic routine.
